revised_title: Walter Morley Fletcher: A Life of Science and Service
tldr: The obituary of Sir Walter Morley Fletcher, a notable figure in the world of science, highlights his life, achievements, and contributions to the field of physiology. Fletcher, who passed away in 1933, was known for his work on muscle respiration and his dedication to both scientific research and service to his college, Trinity College, Cambridge. His life was marked by a strong family background in science, a passion for sports, and a deep appreciation for the arts and culture.
